title: Erin Meyer's Culture Map
description: Learn Erin Meyer's Culture Map in one minute.

hook.text: In Japan, 'yes' means 'I hear you.' In America, 'yes' means 'I agree.' Same word, different meaning.

buildup.text: Erin Meyer's Culture Map plots cultures across eight communication dimensions.

discovery.text: The key dimensions: low-context (direct, US/Germany) vs. high-context (indirect, Japan/China).

twist.text: What feels 'rude' in one culture feels 'efficient' in another. Neither is wrong â€” they're different operating systems.

climax.text: Before working cross-culturally, study where your culture falls on Meyer's map. Then study theirs.

punchline.text: Global teams fail on culture, not capability. Learn the map.

quiz.question: What's the key distinction in Erin Meyer's Culture Map?
